BiblioEntry.Title: Elicitation of neurological knowledge with argument-based machine learning
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Elicitation of neurological knowledge with argument-based machine learning / Vida Groznik ... [et al.]

BiblioSet.Title: Artificial intelligence in medicine
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Artificial intelligence in medicine

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Objective: The paper describes the use of expert's knowledge in practice and the efficiency of a recently developed technique called argument-based machinelearning (ABML) in the knowledge elicitation process. We are developinga neurological decision support system to help the neurologists differentiate between three types of tremors: Parkinsonian, essential, and mixed tremor (comorbidity). The system is intended to act as a second opinion for the neurologists, and most importantly to help them reduce the number of patients in the "gray area" that require a very costly further examination (DaTSCAN). We strive to elicit comprehensible and medically meaningful knowledge in such a way that it does not come at the cost of diagnostic accuracy. Materials and methods: To alleviate the difficult problem of knowledge elicitation from data and domain experts, we used ABML. ABML guidesthe expert to explain critical special cases which cannot be handled automatically by machine learning. This very efficiently reduces the expert'sworkload, and combines expert's knowledge with learning data. 122 patients were enrolled into the study. Results: The classification accuracy ofthe final model was 91%. Equally important, the initial and the final modelswere also evaluated for their comprehensibility by the neurologists. All13 rules of the final model were deemed as appropriate to be able to support its decisions with good explanations. Conclusion: The paper demonstrates ABML's advantage in combining machine learning and expert knowledge. The accuracy of the system is very high with respect to the currentstate-of-the-art in clinical practice, and the system's knowledge base is assessed to be very consistent from a medical point of view. This opens upthe possibility to use the system also as a teaching tool.

= Journal for the theory and aplication in mechanical engineering
= Žurnal dlja mašinostroitel'noj teorii i praktiki
= Zeitschrift zur Theorie und Praxis des Maschinenbaus

BiblioEntry.Abstract: In the paper the results of the doctoral research in which a new knowledge- focused approach to quality management called Deep Quality Concept (DQC) is conceptualised, are presented in short. The main features of the new quality management model developed on that approach also are presented. Particular attention is paid to expert knowledge - especially tacit and deep domain knowledge, i.e. on knowledge that is not only decisive for quality, but also for the competitive advantage of an organisation. Given that such knowledge is hard or even impossible to be formalised by traditional methods, computer concepts - including artificial intelligence (AI) concepts, also are included in the model. The DQC model contains both, i.e. (1) the part concerning development of quality standard i.e. quality award criteria based on the developed approach; and (2) the part concerning implementation of the so obtained standard i.e. award criteria. The main points and potential of the model and approach are validated in the case study by example of delivery time estimate in ship-repair, aimed to get a more transparent assessment and decision structure through the use of machine learning - one of the AI's best known and efficient knowledge acquisition and representing techniques. The application results showed that the proposed approach can contribute significantly to the more reliable quality, particularly in complex and highly dynamic and stochastic domains. That confirmed that computer and AI concepts need to be considered as an integral part of quality management systems, as it is anticipated in the DQC model.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: The awareness about the importance of knowledge within the quality management community is increasing. For example, the Malcolm Baldrige Criteria for Performance Excellence recently included knowledge management into one of its categories. However, the emphasis in research related to knowledge management is mostly on knowledge creation and dissemination, and not knowledge formalisation process. On the other hand, identifying the expert knowledge andexperience as crucial for the output quality, especially in dynamic industries with high share of incomplete and unreliable information such as ship repair, this paper argues how important it is to have such knowledge formalised. The paper demonstrates by example of delivery time estimate how for that purpose the deep quality concept (DQC)-a novel knowledge-focused quality management framework, and machine learning methodology could be effectively used. In the concluding part of the paper, the accuracy of the obtained prediction models is analysed, and the chosen model is discussed. Theresearch indicates that standardisation of problem domain notions and expertly designed databases with possible interface to machine learning algorithms need to be considered as an integral part of any quality management system in the future, in addition to conventional quality management concepts.

BiblioEntry.Title: Predicting seam appearance quality
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Predicting seam appearance quality / Daniela Zavec Pavlinić ... [et al.]

BiblioSet.Title: Textile research journal
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Textile research journal

Notes.Note: Soavtorji: Jelka Geršak, Janez Demšar and Ivan Bratko

BiblioEntry.Abstract: The appearance of a garment is affected by the quality of the fabrics used in its manufacture, as well as a number of factors determined by the technology of the garment manufacturing process. Since fabric quality, as the most important element of garment appearance, is determined by its mechanical properties, it is obvious that these properties directly impact fabric processing properties. It can be seen through various forms of fabric behaviorunder the loads that occur in sewing. Investigations of the correlations of the stress and fabric behavior are aimed at constructing a system to predict fabric behavior in garment manufacturing processes, as well as to predict the appearance of the garment to be manufactured. The investigation presented here deals with the impact of fabric mechanical properties on the quality of seam appearance, as defined by seam puckering andwork-piece flotation. Machine learning methods included in the Orange software package were used to establish the importance of mechanical properties with respect to fabric behavior.

BiblioEntry.Title: A quality management model based on the "deep quality concept"
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: A quality management model based on the "deep quality concept" / Alira Srdoč, Alojzij Sluga, Ivan Bratko

BiblioSet.Title: The international journal of quality and reliability management
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: The international journal of quality and reliability management

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Purpose - According to many authors, differences in firm performances are increasingly attributed to tacit knowledge that cannot easily be transmitted or imitated. On the other hand, current quality management models knowledge typically relates only to people. Situations, in which knowledge that is related to people is not available, sufficient, reliable or lucrative for application, are not considered. This paper aims to investigate how to overcome this gap. Design/methodology/approach - Based on the adopted classification, types of knowledge typically present in an organisation are identified, and are discussed. Techniques for acquiring and formalising tacit knowledge are explored, and related criteria are defined. Particular attentionis shown to knowledge management and artificial intelligence techniques. Findings - A new approach to quality management called deep quality concept (DQC) is conceptualised, and mechanisms and concepts needed toacquire and integrate formalised knowledge into quality systems are identified. Other concepts that need to be incorporated are also identified. Finally, a new quality management model based on the DQC is developed. Research limitations/implications - In further research the main points of the presented theoretical framework need to be validated through real examples from practice, and the resulting quality standard, i.e. award criteria, as well as the related handbooks completed and formalised. Practical implications- Knowledge-related and other relevant concepts need to be incorporated into contemporary quality management systems, as systematically and carefully as conventional quality management concepts. Knowledge of methods and tools suitable for that also needs to be assimilated. Originality/value - In the paper a novel knowledge-focused approach to quality management is presented. For this reason the paper is of great value for quality management theory and practice.
BiblioEntry.Descriptors: quality management /quality management techniques /knowlwdge management /artificial intelligence

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Construction of a prognostic model is presented for the long-term outcome after femoral neck fracture treatment with implantation of hip endoprosthesis.While the model is induced from the follow-up data, we show that the use of additional expert knowledge is absolutely crucial to obtain good predictive accuracy. A schema is proposed where domain knowledge is encoded as a hierarchical decision model of which only a part is induced from the data while the rest is specified by the expert. Although applied to hip endoprosthesis domain, the proposed schema is general and can be used for the construction of other prognostic models where both follow-up data and human expertise is available.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Določitev zaporedja organskih baz na kromosomih človeka in nekaterih drugih organizmih je šele prvi korak na poti proti dolgoročnemu cilju genetskih raziskav: določitvi genov ter razkritju njihovih funkcij in medsebojnega delovanja. V tem prispevku predstavljamo enega od možnih pristopov k reševanju naštetih problemov. Kot plod sodelovanja med Ljubljansko Fakulteto zara`unalništvo in informatiko ter Baylor College of Medicine v Houstonu (Texas, ZDA) je bila razvita metodologija, ki uporablja podatke o mutantih in predznanje genetikov za iskanje možnih genetskih poti. Pilotski program potrjuje uporabnost predlagane sheme, zato načrtujemo izdelavo programa, ki bouporaben kot "inteligentni asistent" pri genetskih poskusih.

BiblioSet.Title: Artificial intelligence for engineering design, analysis and manufacturing
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Artificial intelligence for engineering design, analysis and manufacturing
BiblioSet.Keytitle: Artif. intell. eng. des. anal. manuf.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: This paper addresses an important application machine learning (ML) in design.One of the major bottlenecks in the process of engineering analysis by using the finite-element method--a design of the finite-element mech--was a subject of improvememnt. Defining an appropriate geometric mech model that ensures low approximation errors and avoids unnecessary computational overhead is a very difficult and time- consuming task based mainly on the user's experience. A knowledge base for finite-element mech design has been constructed using the ML techniques. Ten mech models have been used as a source of training examples. The mech dataset was probably the first real-world relational dataset and became one of the most widely used training set for experimenting with inductive logic programming (ILP) systems. After several experiments with different ML systems in the last few years, the ILP system CLAUDIEN was chosen to construct the rules for determining the apppropriate mech resolution values. The ILP has been found to be an effective approach to the problem of mech design. An evaluation of the resulting knowledge base shows that the mech design patterns are captured well by the induced rules and represent a solid basis for practical application. The aim of this paper is not only to present the real-life ML application to designe, but also to describe and discuss a relation of the work being done to the topic of this special issue: the proposed "dimensions" of ML in design.

BiblioEntry.Title: Analiza implantacij kolčnih endoprotez z regresijskimi drevesi = Regression tree analysis of indications concerning hip arthroplasty

BiblioSet.Title: Informatica medica slovenica
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Informatica medica slovenica

BiblioEntry.Abstract: An objective of this research was to determine new hypotheses concerning hip arthroplasty after an acute medial femoral neck fracture. The Harris hip scorewas estimated for 111 patients treated with bipolar or total hip endoprostheses. The average follow-up time was 3.5 years, range 1.5-8.5 years.The obtained data were analyzed by using the Retis system for induction of regression trees. Following are some new hypotheses that were generated by the system Retis: the neurological diseases combined with pulmonary diseases and cardiovascular diseases could have major impact on the long-term clinical outcome after hip arthroplasty. The shorte the period from the injury until the opeation the better the long-term outcome of thehip arthroplasty. it was found that younger patients with bipolar hip endoprosthesis could have better long-term clinical outcome then elderly patients with the same type of endoprosthesis.

BiblioEntry.Title: Dynamic system simulation with qualitative differential equations
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Dynamic system simulation with qualitative differential equations / Ivan Bratko

BiblioSet.Title: Lecture notes in computer science
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Lecture notes in computer science

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Qualitative differential equations (QDE) are a popular formalism for modelling dynamic systems qualitatively. This paper briefly introduces the basic concepts of this approach, including types of constraints used in QDE and the QSIM simulation algorithm. It also discusses the relation of QSIM to other approaches to qualitative modelling, such as confluences and Qualitative Physics Theory, and the advantages and limitations of QSIM. Selected annotated bibliography is also given.

BiblioSet.Title: 22nd International Workshop on Qualitative Reasoning, 24-26 June 2008, University of Colorado, Boulder CO USA
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: 22nd International Workshop on Qualitative Reasoning, 24-26 June 2008, University of Colorado, Boulder CO USA / [editors Elizabeth Bradley, Louise Travé-Massuyès]

BiblioEntry.Abstract: In this paper, we describe the autonomous learning of qualitative models with a robot's on-board vision. Those models are used to describe spatio-temporal qualitative relations between observed objects. Therefore, the algorithm QING is described which extracts the necessary qualitative relations between the objects from the sequence of images. The robot uses these features together with other sensory data to learn about the environment.

BiblioEntry.Title: Induction of qualitative models using discrete Morse theory
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Induction of qualitative models using discrete Morse theory / Jure Žabkar ... [et al.]

AuthorGroup.CorpAuthor: 21st International Workshop on Qualitative Reasoning, June 26-28, 2007,lock1 Aberystwyth University, Wales, U. K.

BiblioSet.Title: QR07
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: QR07 / 21st International Workshop on Qualitative Reasoning, June 26-28, 2007, Aberystwyth University, Wales, U. K.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Qualitative models are often a useful abstraction of the physical word. Learning qualitative models from numerical data is a possible way to obtain such an abstraction. We present a new approach to induction of qualitative models from numerical data whivh is based on discrete Morse theory (DMT). Our algorithm QING (ualitative INduction Generalized) has a firm theoretical background in computational topology. This makes it possible to extend the capabilities of state-of-the-art algorithms for qualitative modelling substantially. The output of QING is a labeled graph, which enables a visualisation of the qualitative model. Induced qualitative models can also be used for numerical regression by applying the ▫$Q^2$▫ method. To ilustrate the power of QING we present its application on an artificial function, add noice, and finally show how it performs on a dynamic domain such as inverted pendulum.

BiblioSet.Title: MEDINFO 2001 : proceedings of the 10th World congress on medical informatics, London, UK, 2-5 September, 2001
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: MEDINFO 2001 [Elektronski vir] / V.L. Patel, R. Rogers and R. Haux (Eds.)
BiblioSet.Subtitle: proceedings of the 10th World congress on medical informatics, London, UK, 2-5 September, 2001

BiblioEntry.Abstract: One of the applications of clinical information systems is decision support. Although the advantages of utilizing such aids have never been theoretically disputed, they have been rarely used in practice. The factor that probably often limits the utility of clinical decision support systems is the need for computing power at the very site of decision making-at the place where the patient is interviewed, in discussion rooms, etc. The paper reports on a possible solution to this problem. A decision-support shell LogReg is presented, which runs on a handheld computer. A general schema for handheld-based decision support is also proposed, where decision models are developed on personal computers/workstations, encoded in XML and then transferred to handhelds, where the models are used within a decision support shell. A use case where LogReg has been applied to clinical outcome predictionin crush injury is presented.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: This paper addresses the question of how to adjust the managerial approach to quality (TQM), which was originally oriented towards the private sector, to the public sector for improved usefulness. The major obstacles are ots limitedflexibility (legislative restrictions for resource allocation) and the specifoc status of direct and indirect users/consumers and ways and siurces ofpayment for the public servises. The authors is against the straightforward use of the existing business models for quality assessment, and suggest that these be adapted before implementing them in the public sector.

BiblioSet.Title: Machine learning and data mining : methods and applications
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Machine learning and data mining / edited by Ryszard S. Michalski, Ivan Bratko, Miroslav Kubat
BiblioSet.Subtitle: methods and applications

BiblioEntry.Abstract: The finite element method (FEM) is the most successful numerical method used extensively by engineers to analyse stresses and deformations in physical structures. In FEM, such structures have to be represented as finite element meshes. Defining an appropriate geometric mesh model that ensures low approximation errors and avoids unnecessary computational overheads is a very difficult and time consuming task. It is the major bottleneck in the FEM analysis process. In practice, FE mesh design is based on the user`s experience. No satisfacory general method exists for the automatic construction of FE meshes. Here we describe the applications of several ML systems to learning how to design FE meshes from examples of known good meshes. In the most recent experiments, the Inductive Logic Programming (ILP) system CLAUDIEN has been employed to construct rules for determining the appropriate mesh resolution values. Ten cylindrical mesh models have been used as a source of training examples. An evaluation of the resulting knowledge base shows that the mesh design patterns are captured well by the induced rules. A comparison between the results obtained by this knowledge base and conventional mesh generation techniques confirms that ILP is an effective approach to the problem of mesh design.

BiblioEntry.Title: Handling imperfect data in inductive logic programming

BiblioSet.Title: Advances in inductive logic programming
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Advances in inductive logic programming / Edited by L. De Raedt

SeriesInfo.Title: Frontiers in artificial intelligence and applications

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Early Inductive Logic Programming (ILP) systems were mostly interactive and assumed correct data. With the advent of empirical ILP interest in handling imperfect data in ILP has increased. Many recent empirical ILP systems include elaborate mechanisms for handling imperfect data include the development of new heuristics, advanced search techinques, as well as techniques for handling real-valued data. The paper gives a survey of these advances with a special emphasis on the developments in the ESPRIT III Project 6020 Inductive Logic Programming.

BiblioEntry.Title: Univerzalna vhodna računalniška naprava : patentna prijava P-9700227
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Univerzalna vhodna računalniška naprava : patentna prijava P-9700227 / izumitelj: Popović Branislav ... [et al.]
BiblioEntry.Subtitle: patentna prijava P-9700227
BiblioEntry.PublisherISBD: Ljubljana : Urad RS za intelektualno lastnino, 1997
BiblioEntry.Abstract: Predmet izuma je univerzalna računalniška vhodna naprava, ki združuje in nadgrajuje funkcije konvencionalne tipkovnice, kazalne naprave in grafičnih tablic. Osnovna naprava je senzitivna plošča s skanirnimi senzorji, referenčnim senzorjem ter s krmilnikom. Skanirni senzorji so vpeti med ploščo in podlago, referenčni senzor pa je vpet med utež in podlogo. Naprava zaznava in razpoznava mesto dotika medija in v vseh treh koordinatah x, y, z silo ter smer pritiska medija in sunek ter smer sunka meddija ter tako zagotavlja izvajanje različnih aktivnosti po plošči: ukaze s kretnjami, tridimenzionalno poziciranje, tipkanje, pametno vnašanje, prostoročno risanje, pisanje in stenografiranje. Pri tem pa daje povratno informacijo preko čolnička na zaslonu in vibratorja.

BiblioEntry.Title: Kvalitativni model srca : magistrsko delo
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Kvalitativni model srca : magistrsko delo / Igor Mozetič
BiblioEntry.Subtitle: magistrsko delo

Notes.Dissertation: Univerza Edvarda Kardelja, Fakulteta za elektrotehniko

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Razvili smo kvalitativni model srca, ki simulira njegovo električno aktivnost. Model je kvalitativen zato, ker so lastnosti vseh objektov v njem opisane s kvalitativnimi (simboličnimi) pojmi, namesto s kvantitativnimi (numeričnimi) vrednostmi. relacije v modelu definirajo odnose med motnjami srčnega ritma, stanji srca, električnimi impulzi v srcu in opisi EKG. S kvalitativno simulacijo modela lahko za vsako kombinacijo motenj ritma izpeljemo vse ustrezne opise EKG. Model smo uporabili za avtomatsko generiranje baze znanja vseh možnih kombinacij motenj srčnega ritma in ustreznih opisov EKG. Baza znanja je uporabna v ekspertnem sistemu za EKG diagnostiko motenj srčnega ritma. Kvalitativna simulacija modela služi za vzročno razlago delovanja srca. Model srca je formaliziran v predikatnem računu prvega reda in implementiran z orodji logičnega programiranja.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Visokokakovostno oblačilo mora poleg svoje osnovne funkcije in izpolnjevanja zahteve po individualnosti posameznika zagotavljati tudi ustrezno stopnjo udobja pri nošenju, lep videz oziroma formo in ustrezno prileganje anatomskim delom človeškega telesa. Dosedanje vizualno načrtovanje oblačila kot kompleksnega sistema je pogosto težavno, saj ocenjevanje kakovosti videza oblačil temelji na opisnih ocenah, ki so vizualne in zelo subjektivne. To pomeni, da pred izdelavo oblačila ni možno vnaprej predvideti težav pri predelavi tkanine v oblačilo, kot tudi stopnje kakovosti videza izdelanega oblačila. Kakovost videza izdelanih oblačil je povezana z deformacij ami tkanin, do katerih prihaja med procesi izdelave zaradi preoblikovanja iz 2D oblike tkanine v 3D obliko oblačila kot tudi kasneje pri njegovi uporabi. Ker so za tekstilne materiale značilne velike deformacije pri nižjih obremenitvah,je nujno natančno poznavanje odvisnosti med obremenitvijo in deformacijo v danem območju. To se nanaša na študij mehanskih in fizikalnih lastnosti tkanin oz. njihovih parametrov, saj različne strukture tkanin izkazujejo različne lastnosti. Njihovo poznavanje omogoča objektivno vrednotenje njihovega obnašanja v izdelanem oblačilu in s tem povezane kakovosti videza oblačil.V doktorski disertaciji so izvedene obširne teoretične in eksperimentalne raziskave mehanskih in fizikalnih lastnosti tkanin in njihovega vpliva na kakovost videza izdelanih oblačil, na podlagi katerih je razvit sistem za napovedovanje kakovosti videza oblačil. Sistem je oblikovan s pomočjo metod strojnega učenja, kjer je uporabljena metoda najbližjih sosedov k-NN, ki je implementirana v programski sistem Orange. Učna množica je zgrajena tako, da učni primeri predstavljajo lastnosti analiziranih tkanin in sicer parametri mehanskih in fizikalnih lastnosti predstavljajo atribute, medtem ko so dejavniki videza oblačil opredeljeni kot razredi. Vsi atributi in razredi so obravnavani zvezno, razen konstrukcijskega parametra vezave. V okviru baze podatkov so oblikovane ustrezne domene, ki se nanašajo na dejavnike videza oblačil (pad oz. podajanje oblačila, zagotavljanje 3D oblike, kakovost pristajanja oblačila, kakovost videza izdelanih šivov in kakovost videza celotnega oblačila). Za vsako domeno so s strani strokovnjaka s področja domen in metode najbližjih sosedov k-NN kot metode strojnega učenja, definirani vplivni parametri mehanskih in fizikalnih lastnosti glede na njihovo pomembnost. Na podlagi oblikovanih učnih množic je razvit sistem za napovedovanje kakovosti videza oblačil. Ta je podlaga za inženirsko načrtovanje visokokakovostnih oblačil kot tudi kakovostnih zahtev tkanin za oblačila in temelji na proučevanju parametrov mehanskih in fizikalnih lastnosti tkanin ter njihovih vplivov na stopnjo kakovosti videza izdelanih oblačil. Napoved kakovosti videza oblačil, ki jo podaja razvit sistem, se nanaša na stopnjo pada oz. podajanja in pristajanja oblačil, zagotavljanje 3D oblike, kakovost izdelanih šivov in na stopnjo kakovosti videza oblačila kot celote. Na podlagi rezultatov raziskav, zgrajene baze podatkov in oblikovanega sistema za napoved kakovosti videza oblačil je ugotovljeno, da med posameznimi parametri mehanskih in fizikalnih lastnosti tkanin in videzom izdelanih oblačil obstaja neposredna povezanost. Na posamezen dejavnik kakovosti videza oblačila vpliva različno število atributov. Med stopnjo kakovosti videza izdelanega oblačila in napovedano vrednostjo stopnje kakovosti videza oblačila obstaja statistično pomembna korelacija. Pomemben znanstveni prispevek disertacije predstavlja postavitev relacije med parametri mehanskih in fizikalnih lastnosti tkanin in stopnjo kakovosti videza izdelanih oblačil, kar je izhodišče za objektivno vrednotenje kakovosti videza oblačil. Oblikovan sistem za napovedovanje kakovosti videza oblačil ima tudi aplikativen pomen za širše področje tekstilstva, saj je na podlagi parametrov mehanskih in fizikalnih lastnosti tkanin,dobljena napoved pomembna informacija pri načrtovanju in razvoju novih visokokakovostnih tkanin in oblačil. Širino aplikativnemu prispevku disertacije daje razvit, uporabniku prijazen, sistem za napovedovanje kakovosti videza oblačil, ki je dostopen preko svetovnega spleta. S tem je omogočen hitrejši prenos znanja med znanstvenimi institucijami in v prakso.

High-quality articles of clothing should, besides fulfilling the requirements of the end-use properties, be distinguished by high-quality appearance, perfect fit to human body and comfort in wearing. Those factors should be considered in engineering planning and development of such complex articles of clothing. While the quality of garment appearance is assessed visually and subjectively, it is hard to speak in advance of the quality of the manufactured garment appearance, as it can be improved even after the garment has been finished. The quality of a garment appearance is closely connected with fabric deformations that occur due to the loads the fabrics are exposed to, both in the manufacture and in use. As textile fabrics are characterised by high level of deformation at low loads, it is necessary to be familiar with the correlation of load and deformation in this respect. It is associated with the study of mechanical and physical properties of the fabrics used, e.g.their parameters, since different fabric structures result in different properties. Knowing these properties enables objective evaluation of the garment appearance quality, as a subjective assessment in this field does not offer satisfactory results. In the course of the investigations described in this doctoral thesis, a system was developed for predicting garment appearance quality, such that could be included into the engineering prediction of textile fabrics and high-quality articles of c1othing. The system is based on studying fabric mechanical and physical properties, as well as on the correlation of the se properties and the degree of garment appearance quality. A method of machine learning was used in designing the system, e.g. the method of nearest neighbours, implemented in the Orange software package. The need to solve the problem is quite evident in garment industry, as it is necessary to supplement the subjective assessment of garment appearance quality with objective evaluation. The information to be obtained by the system include the_ degree of garment drape, Le. its fit, 3D shape of the garment in question, quality of the seams made, as well as the quality of the garment appearance in general. The results obtained are presented as correlation between mechanical and physical properties and their impact on construction parameters (yam density, weave and fabric surface mass) are presented first. The grades of garment appearance quality follow, sorted by various procedures of evaluation. Evaluations were performed either in direct manufacture or based on pictorial presentation. Grade values obtained were analysed, and the analysis used to comp are the exactness of the prediction as compared to the ones obtained by the system developed. The results obtained for the impact of the fabric mechanical and physical property parameters on the degree of appearance quality indicate considerable correlation. The impact of important fabric parameters on the garment appearance quality was determined, on one hand on the basis of the expert experience and knowledge in the field of garment engineering, and on the other employing the algorithm method of the nearest neighbours, where fabric properties of lower importance were eliminated. Finally, the results of predicting the degree of quality were given and compared with the evaluation concerning each individual factor of garment appearance. The conclusions are obtained through the theory developed, as well as from the results obtained. The scientific contribution of the thesis is explained as the replacement of the subjective evaluation of garment appearance quality by the objective method of evaluation. The usability of the system for predicting garment appearance quality in the general field of textiles is presented, as the prediction obtained is important information in designing and developing new high-quality articles of clothing. It can also be us ed in fabric purchase, as criteria of fabric quality are also determined, such that ensure the target degree of quality in the article of clothing to be manufactured. Scientific contribution of the thesis is also the user-friendly system for predicting garment appearance quality developed in the investigations described, available on the world wide net. It will make the transfer of knowledge between research institutions and industry faster and more efficient.

BiblioEntry.Title: Določanje mešanice bombažnih prediv z metodami umetne inteligence : disertacija
BiblioEntry.Subtitle: disertacija

Notes.Dissertation: Dokt. dis., Univerza v Mariboru, Fakulteta za strojništvo

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Številne raziskave s področij teorije prdenja so pokazale, da lahko z uporabo ustreznega prediva in s pravilnim mešalnim razmerjem vplivmo na mehanske lastnosti in enakomernost preje ter občutno zmanjšamo količino napak v peji. Predloženo delo predstavlja raziskavo vpliva kakovostnih značilnosti bombažnega prediva in konstrukcijskih parametrov preje na najpomembnejše lastnosti bompažne preje ter uporabo dobljenih rezultatov za določanje kakovostno in cenovno optimirane mešanice bombažnih prediv. Kompleksen proces določanja mešanice bombažnih prediv je v veliki meri pogojen z ustreznimi modeli napovedovanja rezultirajočih lastnosti bombažnih prej, podrobnim poznavanjem lastnosti bombažnega prediva in upoštevanjem parametrov proizvodnega procesa. Izsledki teoretičnega dela raziskave so strnjeni v modelu projektiranja bombažnih prej, katerega sonovni komponenti sta regresijski model za napovedovanje lastnosti bombažnih prstanskih in rotorskih prej ter model kakovostnega in cenovnega optimiranja mešanice bombažnih prediv. Z uporabo strojnega učenja iz primerov je bil izdelan regresijski model napovedovanja, ki je pomembno povečal točnost napovedi najpomembnejših lastnosti bombažne preje: pretržne napetosti, pretržnega raztezka, enakomernosti preje in količine napak v preji. Zgrajena regresijska drevesa so pomenila osnovo za realizacijo kakovostnega in cenovnega optimiranja bombažnih prediv, kjer je bila z upoštevanjem specifičnih predilskih omejitev z linearnim programiranjem določena sestava mešanice. Za primerjavo med napovedanimi in izmerjenimi vrednostmi raziskanih lastnosti bombažnih prej je bila razvita povsem nova metoda analitičnega vrednotenja in grafične predstavitve t.i. "Celovitega Indeksa Kakovosti - CIK" preje. Grafična predstavitev ima obliko kontrolnega diagrama in predstavlja zaradi nazornosti prikaza velik potencial referenčnega dokumenta sodobne predilnice, njegova uporabnost pa sega tudi na področje dialoga med predilnico in kupci njenih izdelkov. Z realizacijo raziskave so dane možnosti za učinkovit sistem upravljanja z vlakninskim materialom, načrtovanje in projektiranje prej in racionalno rabo surovin ob visoki kakovosti izpredene bombažne preje. Oblikovani modeli napovedovanja lastnosti prstanskih in rotorskih prej ter določannja mešanice bombažnih prediv omogočajo dopolnitve podatkovnih baz za predilnice, kjer so v uporabi drugi sistemi predenja in druge vrste prediv.

Numerous researches from theory and technology of spinning have shown how we can influence the mechanical properties and regularity of a yarn as well as significantly reduce the number of yarn faults using the appropriate raw material and suitable mixing proportion. The proposed work represents a study of the influence of quality characteristics of cotton fibres and constructional parameters of a yarn on the most important properties of cotton yarn. The achieved results have been used for determination of optimised cotton fibre blends regarding the quality of price of a cotton yarn. A complex procedure of cotton fibre blend determination significantly depends on suitable models for prediction of properties of resulting cotton yarns, in-depth knowledge of characteristics of cotton fibres and consideration of parameters of a production process. The results of a theoretical part of the research have been summed up in a model of cotton yarn engineering, which main components are regression model for prediction ofproperties of cotton ring and rotor yarns, and model for optimisation of cotton fibre blends regarding the quality and price. The regression predictionmodel has been designed using one of artificial intelligence methods: the machine learning from examples. The prediction accuracy for forecasting the breaking tenacity, breaking extension, and regularity of cotton yarns, as well as amount of yarn faults, was significantly improved. The obtained regression trees served as a basis for realisation of a model for optimisation of cotton fibre blends regarding the quality and price of resulted yarn. Special linear programming techniques, supplemented by specific spinning technology constraints have been used for this purpose. An entirely new method of analytic evaluation and graphical representation of a so-called Yarn "Total Quality Index - TQI" has been developed in order to enable the comparison between the predicted and measured properties of investigated properties of cotton yarns. The graphical representation has formof a control diagram and because of its clearness provides a potential fora referential document of a modern spinning mill. Furthermore, it can be succesfully used for establishing the indubitable dialogue between a spinning mill and its customers. Realisation of the research provides the possibilities for efficient fibre management system, planning, and engineeringof cotton yarns and economic use of raw materials while producing the high quality cotton yarns. The designed models for prediction of properties of cotton ring and rotor spun yarns and determination of cotton fibre blends enable the supplement of data bases also for spinning mills that use other spinning systems and raw materials.

BiblioEntry.SeriesInfoISBD: Sveučilište u Rijeci, Tehnički fakultet Rijeka. Magistarski rad

Notes.Dissertation: Sveuč. u Rijeci, Tehn. fakult., 1991

BiblioEntry.Abstract: This thesis explains the need for building an expert system for operational production planning in ship repairing. Possibilities of realisation of such system are explored, particularly from the point of view of development degree of the planning techniques in artificial intelligence and constructive expert systems, and the most appropriate one is choosen. The main characteristics of prototype realisation of expert system for redelivery term estimatin, as one of the most important element of operational production planning, are described. At the end the review of results attained by testing as well as the recommendations for further work are given.

U radu se obrazlaže potreba za izgradnjom ekspertnog sustava za operativno planiranje proizvodnje u brodoremontu. Istražuju se mogućnosti realizacije jednog takvog sustava, posebno sa stajališta postignutog stupnja razvoja tehnika planiranja u umjetnoj inteligenciji i konstruktivnih ekspertnih sustava, i bira najprimjerenija. Opisuju se glavne značajke realizacije prototipa ekspertnog sustava za procjenu roka, kao jednog od najvažnijih elemenata operativnog planiranja proizvodnje. Na kraju se daje pregled rezultata postignutih testiranjem, kao i smjernice za daljnji rad.
